pullRequest.body:
Add some stacks tags to etale, flat, unramified etc morphisms.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in June 2024.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9731762457/job/26856596457)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9731762457/job/26856596355)
Often just `v` suffices for arrow heads in ASCII. :-)

```suggestion
-- Assume that the rings are in a commutative diagram as above
```
These could even be single `/-! ... -/` comments.

```suggestion
/-- The localization of a formally √©tale map is formally etale. -/
```

We had a discussion about this during the session, and I pointed out that searching for ad√®le in Lean was a pain for me because I didn't have an √® on my keyboard. People on the call whose first language contained accents immediately told me how to do it on Ubuntu (Alt-Gr # e) and now look at me I'm writing accents in github comments, but do you think there's an argument @semorrison for de-accenting words like this? Alternatively, should the Lean declaration be `FiniteAd√®leRing`?

I never put the accent on the "a" in `TuranGraph`/`IsTuranMaximal` in #9317, but (knowing that you can type absolutely any Unicode character in Ubuntu using Ctrl-Shift-U then the codepoint) put the accent everywhere _in the commentary_. The Lean declaration should be `FiniteAdeleRing`, without accent.
OK Michael Stoll on the Zulip has convinced me you're right (and `FiniteAd√®leRing` is apparently not valid).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc:add some comments and stacks tags
